definition: to pass on a present
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)

sentences.english: Before I escape, I gave the allowance my mother gave me to the old lady.
sentences.chinese: 逃离之时，我把妈妈早上给的零花钱转赠给老人家。

definition: to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)
to pass on a task/to delegate one's work/to pass the buck
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to part with sth cherished/to forsake
to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to take for one's own/to expropriate
to lend
to hand over
variant of 賜予|赐予[ci4 yu3]
to resell
to purchase/to acquire
